content.description:
POLITICAL EFFICACY AND PARTY AFFILIATION

Source: Pew Research Center, 2015.
content.question: Which of the following conclusions is best supported by the graphs?

choices.label: Political efficacy is a major factor in shaping political views about government, but political ideology also plays a role.
Regardless of party, there is a great deal of ideological agreement about the role of government among those with greater political efficacy.
While trust in government has declined over time, this is due to a decrease in political efficacy.
Republicans promote trust in government, which increases political efficacy.

content.answer: Political efficacy is a major factor in shaping political views about government, but political ideology also plays a role.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
